intro: Fleurya umbellata, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale blue. The plant features a short, hairy stem with opposite leaves that are often ovate or elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens. Fleurya umbellata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
